html: 8.6.17  11:33 am   Hi, so I REALLY wanna learn to play the drums. I play guitar and bass, so I'm already familiar with playing music and how rhythm works (all the note/rest values, ties, triplets, etc. I'm even comfortable playing syncopated lines, polyrhythms, different time signatures and all that stuff) But when I actually try to sit down at a set and play around, I sound awful.. Do you think its mostly about building up muscle memory, just getting used to the technique and feeling of the drums? Another roadblock is that I don't own a kit (I live in an old apartment building, with VERY thin walls), so I practice either by tapping my feet while tapping on stuff with my hands, or by "air drumming". I really only get to play on an actual kit once a week or so at most (when I go over to a friends house for band practice). Any tips or advice???

8.5.17  9:10 pm   If we could somehow quantify the act of being reasonable,

     would you want the unit to be called a Wurtz?

     I.e. if you're being completely unreasonable, you're operating at 0 Wurtz, but if you're super reasonable, that's maybe 6 Wurtz. I estimate you are at a level of about 7.9 Wurtz so I doubt we can go higher. Also it's logarithm like the Richter scale so every increment of 1 Wurtz is 10 times more reasonable than the last Wurtz (e.g. 5 Wurtz is 100 times more reasonable than 3 Wurtz)
